# offset

**Instance Property**

The time, in seconds, at which the animation begins within the duration.

## Declaration

```swift
var offset: TimeInterval { get set }
```

## Discussion

The default value is `0`, which indicates that the animation plays with no offset. Setting a value for this property moves the animation data along the timeline and doesn’t change timing. If you set a [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/SampledAnimation/fillMode] other than [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/AnimationFillMode/none], the animation fills the vacant area created by the offset according to the characteristics of the specified fill mode.

## Timing the animation

- **speed**: A factor that increases or decreases the animation’s rate of playback.
- **delay**: An amount of time that lapses before the animation plays.
- **duration**: The total playback time of the animation.
- **trimDuration**: An optional duration that overrides the calculated duration.
- **trimStart**: The time, in seconds, at which the source animation plays.
- **trimEnd**: The time, in seconds, at which the source animation stops.
